sub_topic: Show that every group of order 60 is isomorphic to either the cyclic group C60, the alternating group A5 × C2, or one of the 32 non-abelian groups of order 60.
message_1: How many non-abelian groups of order 60 are there? List all the possible non-abelian groups and prove that each of them is isomorphic to one of the three groups mentioned- the cyclic group C60, the alternating group A5×C2, or one of the 32 non-abelian groups of order 60.
message_2:
There are 5 non-abelian groups of order 60 up to isomorphism. These groups are:

1. The alternating group A5
2. The direct product A5 × C1
3. The direct product A4 × C5
4. The direct product S3 × C10
5. The direct product D5 × C6

We will now show that each of these groups is non-abelian and isomorphic to one of the three groups mentioned.

1. The alternating group A5:
A5 is a well-known non-abelian simple group of order 60. It is not isomorphic to C60 since it is non-abelian. It is not isomorphic to A5 × C2 since the order of A5 × C2 is 120. Thus, A5 is one of the non-abelian groups of order 60.

2. The direct product A5 × C1:
This group is isomorphic to A5 since C1 is the trivial group. Thus, it is also one of the non-abelian groups of order 60.

3. The direct product A4 × C5:
A4 is a non-abelian group of order 12, and C5 is a cyclic group of order 5. Their direct product has order 12 × 5 = 60. Since A4 is non-abelian, the direct product is also non-abelian. It is not isomorphic to C60 since it is non-abelian. It is not isomorphic to A5 × C2 since the order of A5 × C2 is 120. Thus, A4 × C5 is one of the non-abelian groups of order 60.

4. The direct product S3 × C10:
S3 is a non-abelian group of order 6, and C10 is a cyclic group of order 10. Their direct product has order 6 × 10 = 60. Since S3 is non-abelian, the direct product is also non-abelian. It is not isomorphic to C60 since it is non-abelian. It is not isomorphic to A5 × C2 since the order of A5 × C2 is 120. Thus, S3 × C10 is one of the non-abelian groups of order 60.

5. The direct product D5 × C6:
D5 is the dihedral group of order 10, and C6 is a cyclic group of order 6. Their direct product has order 10 × 6 = 60. Since D5 is non-abelian, the direct product is also non-abelian. It is not isomorphic to C60 since it is non-abelian. It is not isomorphic to A5 × C2 since the order of A5 × C2 is 120. Thus, D5 × C6 is one of the non-abelian groups of order 60.

In conclusion, there are 5 non-abelian groups of order 60 up to isomorphism. None of them are isomorphic to C60 or A5 × C2, so they are all distinct non-abelian groups of order 60.
